title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (West Orange, NJ) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Usually will hear back within a couple weeks. Truthfully a nice place to work and the productivity standards are reasonable. Pay is non-negotiable apparently. Benefits are decent, nothing crazy, PTO is ok.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (West Orange, NJ) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward and not intimidating whatsoever. I was able to learn more about the expectations as an entry level practitioner and the benefits as well. The opportunities for growth and the ability to work with a variety of patient populations.
Interview Questions: How would you handle another therapist disagreeing with your approach to treating a patient?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: They were very kind. Made you feel very comfortable. Give me the amount of time you wanted to answer your questions. Went over exactly what they expected. Unfortunately I wasn't selected
Interview Questions: What do you like to do outside of work? What is one of your proudest accomplishments at work?

title: Student Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual and friendly interview but very informative and professional as well. There were many details that were given to me about the requirements of the position. The interview was held in an area where I was able to see the work environment.
Interview Questions: Interviewer asked about my past experience

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and everyone was responsive! Everyone takes pride in their work and was available to answer questions. I am excited about the prospect of working at Kessler! I hope this is helpful.
Interview Questions: What drew you to apply to Kessler?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (Marlton, NJ) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Wanted to make sure I had good computer skills, multitasking skills, and was able to work in a face paced environment. There were only a couple of questions and then I was showed around the hospital
Interview Questions: Do you work well in a fast paced environment?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (Marlton, NJ) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the CNO. Very easy process the interview was quick and easy more like a conversation. I saw showed around the hospital and met some of the people on the floor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your computer skills

title: Clinical Fellow In Speech Language Pathology Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: After my application was accepted I completed an online interview with the hiring manager and then an online interview with my clinical supervisor. Hiring manager was friendly. Questions were both personal and clinical in nature.
Interview Questions: What type of speech and language assessments have you administered?

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: The interview was comprehensive and fair with employer assessing skills and knowledge but also taking the time to get to know me as a candidate.  Response time was less than one week.
Interview Questions: They asked how I would evaluate and assess patients based on incoming diagnoses.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview with the HR recruiter after the application and skills assessment.   A couple of weeks later there was a zoom interview with nurse managers.   About a week later I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Why am I leaving my current position

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a phone screen with a recruiter and then progressed to a phone interview with the hiring manager at the specific facility I applied to. The interview was held over the phone due to COVID restrictions. The recruiter was very involved throughout the process and streamlined the hiring process.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to get out of this job?

title: Student Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: It was great -- my interviewer made me feel comfortable and asked inquisitive questions to get a holistic view of me. It lasted about 20 mins in-person and I heard back within a week.
Interview Questions: What are some extracurricular activities you are involved in at school or otherwise?

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: Pretty relaxed and standard questions. They asked about my previous experience and why Kessler. It was an easy conversation. The hiring process took a while, around 4 weeks because of the drug screenings and schedule.
Interview Questions: In what capacity have you worked with patients before?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (West Orange, NJ) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great. manager was nice. I answered a few questions about my past career experience. And explained why I like to work for this company. Tell them what I expect myself in 5 years in this company.
Interview Questions: How will you connect past experience to this RN position?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: The Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation interview was very professional and also welcoming. As a therapist be prepared to answer a lot of questions and meet a bunch of coworkers.  Hope this helps.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: It was more so just a lot of paperwork and getting approved by Kessler. Also needed to get tests done by my PCP and submit results to Kessler. It was stressed that I know the rules of the clinic.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Full Time Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: they asked basic questions asked about experience in the past and the expectations that the employer had. reviewed questions I had. no information provided on details of benefits. I met with the representative from HR and then the head of the department I was interviewing for. once with the head of the department I was given better information regarding the job.
Interview Questions: how long have you worked in the field you are applying for

title: Rehabilitation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
Interview Descriptions: Come in and if they like you you are hired credentials don't matter unless the state requires it for that position that pretty much wraps it just be prepared for constant smart remarks when you start and threats about how you should follow their favored fews leads least that's how it was for me and other coworkers who applied.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (Rochester, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was hone called for an interview after responding to a post online looking for a specific kind of candidate. There was one interview and I was told at the interview that my ICF experience was going to be helpful to me.
Interview Questions: Background

title: Rehab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call within a week after I applied.  My interview was scheduled a week later and in about 2 weeks I started the job.  I had to go in once before starting to fill out paper work and receive the benefits package.  The staff is very friendly and they train you very well.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Rehab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with a supervisor. 2 if they wanted the supervisor on the shift you wanted to interview you. Hiring process easy with HR. Needed no prior experience, certifications, or licenses.
Interview Questions: How you would handle certain situations.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (East Orange, NJ) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, fair, and specific to the job.  Met with a PT, saw a clinic, ensured a good fit.  Met with a PT in a satellite clinic, explained patient caseload, and requirements for employment.  It was uplifting, I was energetic, and happy to be able to meet someone onsite with a PT background.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave last job

title: Rehab Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation (West Orange, NJ) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: They asked the general questions. What work did you perform on your last job? They asked to describe a situation where you had to use your own judgement.
Interview Questions: Describe your most difficult moment on the job.
